text: Psalm 73
The Wicked and the Righteous Contrasted
A song of Asaph.\f + \fr Ps 73 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Surely God is good to Israel,
to those pure of heart.
But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled.
My steps had nearly slipped,
because I envied the boastful
\add when\add* I saw \add the\add* well-being\f + \fr 73:3 \ft Or “peace” or “prosperity” \f* of \add the\add* wicked.
For there are no pains up to their death,
and their bodies \add are\add* ⸤healthy⸥.\f + \fr 73:4 \ft Literally “fat” \f*
They do not have ⸤ordinary trouble⸥,\f + \fr 73:5 \ft Literally “the trouble of man” \f*
and they are not plagued as \add other\add* people.\f + \fr 73:5 \ft Hebrew “humankind” \f*
Therefore pride is their necklace;
an outfit of violence covers them.
Their eye bulges from fat.\f + \fr 73:7 \ft A slightly different Hebrew reading might be reflected in the LXX’s “their iniquity comes out of fatness” \f*
Imaginings overflow \add their\add* heart.
They mock and speak maliciously of oppression;
they speak \add as though\add* from on high.
They set their mouth against the heavens,
and their tongue roams the earth.
Therefore his people turn there,\f + \fr 73:10 \ft That is, toward the wicked \f*
and abundant waters are slurped up by them.
And they say, “How does God know?”
and, “Does the Most High have knowledge?”
See, these \add are the\add* wicked,
and they increase wealth, ever carefree.
Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure,
and washed my hands in innocence.
And I have been plagued all day
and rebuked ⸤every morning⸥.\f + \fr 73:14 \ft Literally “to the mornings” \f*
If I had said, “I will speak thus,”
behold, I would have acted treacherously
against your children’s generation.
When I thought about \add how\add* to understand this,
it \add was\add* troubling in my eyes
until I went into the sanctuary of God.
\add Then\add* I understood their fate.
Surely you set them on slippery places.
You cause them to fall onto ruin.\f + \fr 73:18 \ft Or “fall for deceptions” \f*
How they become a desolation in a moment!
They come to a complete end by terrors.
Like a dream upon awakening,
when \add you\add* wake up, O Lord,
you will despise their fleeting form.\f + \fr 73:20 \ft Or “image” \f*
When my heart was embittered
and I felt stabbed in my kidneys,
then I was brutish and ignorant.
With you I was \add like\add* the beasts.
But I \add am\add* continually with you;
you have hold of my right hand.
You will guide me with your advice,
and afterward you will take me \add into\add* honor.\f + \fr 73:24 \ft Or “\fq to \ft glory” \f*
Whom do I have in the heavens \add except you\add*?
And with you I have no \add other\add* desire on earth.
My flesh and heart failed,
\add but\add* God \add is\add* the ⸤strength⸥\f + \fr 73:26 \ft Literally “rock” \f* of my heart and my reward forever.
For indeed, \add those\add* distancing themselves from you will be ruined.
You destroy each who abandons you for harlotry.
But as for me, the approach to God \add is\add* for my good.
I have set the Lord Yahweh \add as\add* my refuge,
in order to tell all your works.
